summary: This document outlines the Know Your Customer (KYC) details for Jeffrey Epstein and associated parties, including account ownership and financial relationships. It details the establishment of accounts under Neptune LLC, the roles of various individuals involved, and the financial activities related to Epstein's accounts at Deutsche Bank. This document appears to be related to compliance and due diligence procedures for client relationships at Deutsche Bank, specifically in the context of Private Wealth Management. It includes signatures from various professionals and emphasizes the importance of knowing clients and adhering to ethical standards.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a client of Deutsche Bank and is involved in the establishment of accounts for managing funds related to his home in NYC.

persons.name: Paul Morris
persons.context: Paul Morris is the relationship manager for Jeffrey Epstein at Deutsche Bank, having previously worked with him at JP Morgan.

persons.name: Harry Beller
persons.context: Harry Beller is listed as a related party to Epstein's accounts and is noted to have no negative media associated with him.

persons.name: Darren Indyke

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is a client of Deutsche Bank and has multiple accounts under Neptune LLC.
Paul Morris was previously associated with Epstein at JP Morgan before managing his accounts at Deutsche Bank.
Darren Indyke is an authorized signer for Epstein's accounts and is a lawyer at Southern Financial LLC.
Harry Beller is an accountant related to Epstein's financial activities with no negative media associated with him.
The document includes KYC details and financial activities related to Epstein's management of funds.
The document emphasizes the importance of due diligence and maintaining high standards of suitability, background, and character for clients.
Client Facing Professionals (CFPs) are responsible for establishing and maintaining business relationships with clients.
The document includes signatures from multiple staff members, indicating their acknowledgment of the information provided.
